entities.name: Endless Summer
entities.description: Soviet Games made a text-based adventure game with choices.

entities.name: Semyon
entities.description: The player is a male character who avoids relationships. He often plays pranks with Ulyana and Alya. He can see the Pioneer and has a computer. He was previously a secluded person, sometimes compared to machine-gun fire. He found Shurik and his girlfriend after an attack. Other characters include someone pretending to be multiple people, a friend of Alya who might uncover her secrets, and someone sympathetic to Lena.

entities.name: 2ch
entities.description: Semyon's online community.

entities.name: Bus number 410
entities.description: Semyon boards bus number for a trip to hell.

entities.name: Sovyonok
entities.description: The game is called Pioneer. Semyon is trapped in a mysterious camp. This camp is also a cyclical purgatory. He meets Slavya there. Yulia guards an item given to the Semyons across cycles. The story takes place in a parallel dimension or a force field within "Moscow 2."

entities.name: Camp
entities.description: The game is in an inescapable area. Pioneer girls and Sovyonok live there.

entities.name: District Center
entities.description: A location near the camp, accessible within some mods.

entities.name: Moscow 2 Bunker
entities.description: The location of the Sovyonok camp, initially as a force field experiment.

entities.name: Volga Camp
entities.description: The prototype for Sovyonok, represented by photographs from a game developer.

entities.name: Retrospective Mod Series
entities.description: A non-canonical narrative that explores the appearance and world of Sovyonok in detail.

entities.name: Pioneer Girls
entities.description: Local girls who can be interacted with in the game.

entities.name: Routes
entities.description: Paths in the game connected to specific girls.

entities.name: Girlfriends
entities.description: Characters associated with different routes.

entities.name: Heroines
entities.description: Female characters within the game.

entities.name: Mini-games
entities.description: Interactive elements within the game, including a card tournament.

entities.name: Locations
entities.description: Specific areas within the game world, totaling 20 (excluding pre-Sovyonok locations).

entities.name: Pioneer
entities.description:
A figure with a hidden face and eyes, like Semyon. 
A suspicious person appeared near Semyon.
Someone in the camp might be immortal and without feelings.

entities.name: Yulia
entities.description: The cat-girl character is from LHC Inc. She appears with the Pioneer in her ending. She is a mysterious neko-girl guardian of 'Sovyonok' living in catacombs and the main protagonist of the game. She communicated with Shurik in a dark tunnel.

entities.name: Slavya
entities.description: The girl is a camp resident. She lives in a cabin. She has a unique story. She is tall, blonde, with blue eyes, and helps keep things organized at the camp.

entities.name: Slavya-chan
entities.description: The IIchan mascot was created in 2007 and represents Slavic culture. It became more popular than USSR-chan.

entities.name: Lena
entities.description: A character feels sympathy for Semyon and lacks confidence, leading to suicide. This person is a long-time friend of Alya. They are also a modest acquaintance known only to Alya, and a childhood acquaintance. An inscription reads "Lenka is stupid." Ulyana was a primary victim.

entities.name: Unyl-chan
entities.description: The mascot that inspired the creation of Lena, created in 2007.

entities.name: Ulyana
entities.description:
The character is named Lenin. 

He lives in a cabin. 

Lenin is like Miku. 

He has bright red hair and is adventurous. 

Alya’s friend enjoys pranks and adventures, and they are only friends.

entities.name: Lenin
entities.description: The namesake of the character Ulyana.

entities.name: Ulyanov
entities.description: Lenin's real surname, used as the basis for Ulyana's name.

entities.name: USSR-chan
entities.description: An early mascot that influenced the creation of Ulyana.

entities.name: Dvach-chan
entities.description: The mascot overshadowed USSR-chan. It inspired Alya’s creation. Krippi-chan is a side character.

entities.name: Alya
entities.description: Anya Selenzova is a red-haired girl. She scares campmates because she hits them. Electronic fears and avoids her. Anya is friends with Ulyana and lives in the same cabin.

entities.name: Counselor
entities.description: Character with whom Alya frequently gets in trouble.

entities.name: She
entities.description: The main character, acquainted with Lena from childhood.

entities.name: Miku
entities.description:
*   Heroine with a horror route.
*   Friendly, hyperactive girl who loves to talk.
*   Founder of a music club; Alya's friend.

entities.name: Krippi-chan
entities.description: A character featured in some modifications of the game.

entities.name: That's Our Madhouse
entities.description: The musical theme for Krippi-chan.

entities.name: Miku Hatsune
entities.description: The Japanese virtual singer that the basis of Miku was based on.

entities.name: Masha
entities.description: Miku's real name, an adaptation for the Japanese context.

entities.name: IIchan mascot YuVao-chan
entities.description: A mascot character that inspired Yulia's creation.

entities.name: YuVao
entities.description: Yulia's ending and a character name.

entities.name: LHC Inc
entities.description: A bio-tech company made the cat-girl Yulia.

entities.name: Mystery Girl
entities.description: The musical theme of Yulia's character.

entities.name: Olga Dmitrievna
entities.description: The character lives in a cabin. She is a counselor for Semyon’s group.

entities.name: Viola
entities.description: The nurse is middle-aged with different colored eyes. There is another female staff member at the camp.

entities.name: Banhammer-chan
entities.description: A hammer-referencing mascot is a prototype for Olga Dmitrievna, blocking unwanted users.

entities.name: Collider-sama
entities.description: 2ch mascot prototype for Viola.

entities.name: Eternal Longing
entities.description: The character's musical theme.

entities.name: Zhenya
entities.description: A person lives in a cabin, testing a Mitsgol prototype. The librarian is grumpy.

entities.name: Mitsgol
entities.description: This character appeared on 2ch in 2007. It was the prototype for Zhenya.

entities.name: Electronic
entities.description: Shurik's friend is a cyberneticist named Syroyezhkin, like Electronic.

entities.name: Shurik
entities.description: A friend makes a robot in the cybernetics club.

entities.name: Tolik
entities.description: The cafeteria has a strange character. He has a distorted face and draws crudely.

entities.name: Blurry Character 1
entities.description: The character is tired and sits to the right of Tolik. He has a mouth drawn on his forehead.

entities.name: Fantômas
entities.description: A figure seen as a poster on the wall.

entities.name: Bitard
entities.description: A character depicted in multiple posters within the cabins.

entities.name: Vasnetsov
entities.description: Artist whose paintings hang in Slavya and Zhenya's Cabin.

entities.name: Detroit Metal City
entities.description: Anime with a poster in Alya’s cabin.

entities.name: Stalin vs. Martians
entities.description: Game title with a poster in Ulyana’s cabin

entities.name: Gav
entities.description: Name of a kitten whose poster is next to the Stalin poster

entities.name: Larionov
entities.description: Soviet-era hockey player potentially featured on a poster in Ulyana's cabin

entities.name: Krutov
entities.description: Soviet-era hockey player potentially featured on a poster in Ulyana's cabin

entities.name: Fetisov
entities.description: Soviet-era hockey player potentially featured on a poster in Ulyana's cabin

entities.name: Makarov
entities.description: Soviet-era hockey player potentially featured on a poster in Ulyana's cabin

entities.name: Kasatonov
entities.description: Soviet-era hockey player potentially featured on a poster in Ulyana's cabin

entities.name: Sickle and Hammer
entities.description: Drawings of sickle and hammer featured on the wallpaper

entities.name: Tsoi
entities.description: Singer with a poster hanging in Miku's cabin

entities.name: Vysotsky
entities.description: Singer with a poster hanging in Miku's cabin

entities.name: Anime Heroine
entities.description: Poster of an anime heroine between the posters of Tsoi and Vysotsky

entities.name: Beatles Postcard
entities.description: Postcard with the Beatles on a shelf in Miku's cabin

entities.name: Japanese Gum
entities.description: Pack of Japanese gum indicating Miku lived in Japan

entities.name: Aftar zzhesh
entities.description: Classic internet phrase on the eye chart

entities.name: Stsukko
entities.description: Classic internet phrase on the eye chart

entities.name: Medical Center
entities.description: The location of the artwork.

entities.name: Eye Chart
entities.description: Contains classic internet phrases and references.

entities.name: Vegetable Poster
entities.description: A reference to the 'I eat vegetables' meme.

entities.name: Alyosha (Kyshtym Dwarf)
entities.description: The skeleton on the left poster belongs to him.

entities.name: Ikari Gendo
entities.description: The monument to Gende is a reference to this character.

entities.name: Gende (Imageboard User)
entities.description: An Easter egg referencing an imageboard user named Gende.

entities.name: Aska
entities.description: Distinctive hairstyle of an anime character.

entities.name: Rei
entities.description: Distinctive hairstyle of an anime character.

entities.name: Misato
entities.description: Distinctive hairstyle of an anime character.

entities.name: Vakaba Sign
entities.description: Appears in the artwork and the camp.

entities.name: Vakaba
entities.description: Advertising sign featuring Vakaba's logo.

entities.name: Syrno
entities.description: Advertising sign featuring Syrno's logo.

entities.name: Winter Tale
entities.description: Visual novel advertised on an advertising board.

entities.name: Alya Selenzova
entities.description: Possible reference to a character, name and surname contain an Easter egg.

entities.name: Team Fortress 2 (TF2)
entities.description: Style of card tournament suits, featuring heroines as classes.

entities.name: Gone with the Wind
entities.description: Lena is reading a book.

entities.name: Spirited Away
entities.description: An anime may be linked to 'Gone with the Wind'.

entities.name: IIchan
entities.description: Software on Semyon's computer.

entities.name: Music Club Board
entities.description: A board with text 'Miku is stupid' written on it.

entities.name: Game Creators
entities.description: Nicknames of the game's creators, likely located to the right of the music club board.

entities.name: Owls
entities.description: Birds found in various locations.

entities.name: Night Lamps
entities.description: Lamps where owls are present.

entities.name: Alya and Ulyana's Cabin
entities.description: Cabin where an owl is peering out of the window.

entities.name: Gendo
entities.description: Character whose mannerisms Shurik mimics.

entities.name: Pedobear
entities.description: A teddy bear referenced as a joke about the character's age.
